alert.note: Alert for New Castle (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 5:19PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern New Castle, northwestern Salem, southern Chester and southwestern Delaware Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 519 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Landenberg to near Wakefield. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Newark, Chester, Pennsville, Westtown, Carneys Point, Elsmere, Kennett Square, New Castle, Penns Grove, Oxford, West Grove, Newport, Arden, Glen Roy, Stanton, Cheyney, Talleyville, Elam and Mount Vernon. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike near exit 1. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 95 in Delaware between mile markers 1 and 23. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northern Delaware...southern New Jersey...and southeastern Pennsylvania.
